title: Trainspotting
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: Too much discrimination in this town, man, ken, likesay? As soon as suit n tie dudes see Heriots or Daniel Stewarts or Edinburgh Academy, they kinday get the hots, ken. Ah mean, would you have said, likesay, ah see you attended Craigroyston?

title: Corporal Cameron of the North West mounted police;
author: Connor, Ralph
snippet: "I am afraid my training has been defective. I have passed through Edinburgh Academy, also the University,  with the exception of my last year. But I am willing to take anything."

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: It was a charity concert in aid of a Middle East relief fund, and an eclectic selection of local musicians had offered their services. There was a Haydn cello piece, a ragbag of Bach, and a selection of anthems from the Edinburgh Academy Chorus. Jamie's chamber orchestra was not performing that night, but he was playing the contrabassoon in an impromptu ensemble that was to accompany the singers.

title: Corporal Cameron of the North West Mounted Police: A Tale of the Macleod Trail
author: Connor, Ralph
snippet: "I am afraid my training has been defective. I have passed throughEdinburgh Academy, also the University, with the exception of my lastyear. But I am willing to take anything."

title: The works of Robert Louis Stevenson;
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: His education, in the formal sense, began at Jedburgh. Thence he went to the Edinburgh Academy, where he was the classmate of Tait and Clerk Maxwell, bore away many prizes, and was once unjustly flogged by Rector Williams.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Wrote in the morning. At eleven went by appointment  with Colin Mackenzie to the New Edinburgh Academy. In the fifth class, Mr. Mitchell's, we heard Greek, of which I am no otherwise  a judge than that it was fluently read and explained.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: Publication of Redgauntlet — Death of Lord Byron — Library and Museum — " The Wallace Chair " — House-Painting, Sfc. — Anecdotes — Letters to Constable, Miss Edgeworth, Terry, Miss Baillie, Lord Montagu, Mr. Southey, Charles Scott, #"c. — Speech at the opening of the Edinburgh Academy  — Death and Epitaph of Maida — Fires in Edinburgh.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: February 14. Mr. Edwards, a candidate for the situation of Rector  in the Edinburgh Academy, a pleasant, gentlemanlike man, and recommended highly for experience and learning ; but he is himself afraid of wanting bodily strength for the work, which requires all the nerve and muscle of Williams. I wish he had been three inches taller, and stout in proportion.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: On Henderson Row, groups of boys were coming out of the Edinburgh Academy, clad in their grey tweed blazers, engaged in the earnest conversation which boys seem to have in groups. In the distance, somewhere within the school buildings, the Academy Pipe Band was practising and she stopped for a moment to listen to the drifting sound of the  bagpipes.

title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: 1 The new Edinburgh Academy was established in 1825. The High School dates from 1519.

author: Scott, Walter
snippet: John Russell 2 and Leonard Homer* came to consult me about the propriety and possibility of retaining the northern pronunciation of the Latin in the new Edinburgh Academy. 4 I will think of it until to-morrow, being no great judge.
